Germany and the United States: deaths per 100,000 people were compared to verify the claim's authenticity.
The early and aggressive testing: and-tracing response of Germany was considered as a factor in assessing the claim.
The datasets tracking COVID: 19 deaths, including Johns Hopkins University, the Kaiser Family Foundation, Our World in Data, and Worldometer, were consulted to evaluate the claim.
The per capita metric of deaths per 100: 000 people was used to quantify the intensity of the epidemic and compare the performance of different countries.
